extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 oz. of dark chocolate, chopped (or use morsels)

recipes.title: Chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake

winePairing.pairingText: Cake can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: InstructionsPreheat the oven to 325F.Lightly brush the bottom and sides of a 6-inch springform pan with oil. Cut out baking paper to line the bottom and sides of the pan. This cheesecake is not baked in a baine marie so the chances of it sticking to the pan are high.Make the cookie dough. Stir together the flour, baking soda and salt. Beat the butter and sugars until light in texture. Add the egg and mix until incorporated. Add the flour mixture. Mix until smooth. Stir in the vanilla essence. Fold in the chocolate.Make the cheese filling. Beat together the cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add the egg and cream. Mix until smooth.Take about a third of the cookie dough and spoon into the lined springform pan. Spread to cover the entire bottom of the pan pressing to make the thickness uniform.Pour in half of the cheese filling.With the remaining cookie dough, make several balls no more than an inch in diameter. Drop seven to nine balls into the filling.Cover the cookie dough balls with the remaining filling.Drop another seven to nine balls onto the second layer of filling.If you have excess cookie dough balls, drop them onto a baking tray and bake them as cookies.Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in a preheated 325F oven. For best results, after turning off the oven, leave the cheesecake there for a couple of hours to cool slowly.Cool the cake completely then chill for at least two hours before removing from the pan.You may want to drizzle the cake with melted chocolate before serving.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 325F.Lightly brush the bottom and sides of a 6-inch springform pan with oil.

Cut out baking paper to line the bottom and sides of the pan. This cheesecake is not baked in a baine marie so the chances of it sticking to the pan are high.Make the cookie dough. Stir together the flour, baking soda and salt. Beat the butter and sugars until light in texture.
Add the egg and mix until incorporated.
Mix until smooth. Stir in the vanilla essence. Fold in the chocolate.Make the cheese filling. Beat together the cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Mix until smooth.Take about a third of the cookie dough and spoon into the lined springform pan.
Spread to cover the entire bottom of the pan pressing to make the thickness uniform.

Pour in half of the cheese filling.With the remaining cookie dough, make several balls no more than an inch in diameter. Drop seven to nine balls into the filling.Cover the cookie dough balls with the remaining filling.Drop another seven to nine balls onto the second layer of filling.If you have excess cookie dough balls, drop them onto a baking tray and bake them as cookies.

Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in a preheated 325F oven. For best results, after turning off the oven, leave the cheesecake there for a couple of hours to cool slowly.Cool the cake completely then chill for at least two hours before removing from the pan.You may want to drizzle the cake with melted chocolate before serving.
